result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Defendant Anthony M Ackerley in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Anthony M Ackerley.  Attorney Lucas D Arras in court for State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
21CF21, 21CF38, 21CF234, 21CF399,21CM147, 22CF41, 22CF125, 22CT98, 22TR66, 22TR67
21CF234, 21CF399, 22CF41, 22CF125 are all set for preliminary hearings.

State - Asks court to take judicial notice of bond in 21CF21. On cases 21CF399, 22CF41 calls Officer Dylan Crist. Witness is sworn in and testifies.  Officer identifies defendant in cases 21CF399, 22CF41.
Court - takes judicial notice of bond in 21CF21.  
Atty Hillestad - cross examines witness
10:28 AM witness is excused.
Parties have no further witnesses.   State - argues for bind over.  Atty Hillestad - no argument.  
Court - finds probable cause in 21CF399, 22CF41 and binds DE over.

10:30 AM State - calls Deputy Adam Zukowski for cases 21CF234, 22CF125.  Witness is sworn in and testifies.  Officer identifies defendant in cases 21CF234, 22CF125.
Atty Hillestad - cross examines witness
Parties have no further witnesses or evident.  State - argues for probable cause and bind over.  Atty Hillestad - no argument
Court - finds probable cause in  21CF234, 22CF125 and binds DE over.  Sets ARGN in 21CF234, 22CF125, 21CF399, 22CF41 with enough time for a plea hearing if matters are resolved.
Arraignment scheduled for January 10, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
